title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0307

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Kathryn, and today we're talking about a very, very important part of conversations in English.
segments.cn: 我叫Kathryn，今天我们要谈论英语对话中一个非常重要的部分。

segments.en: That's right.
Today we are introducing a new series all about small talk.
segments.cn: 今天我们将介绍一个关于闲聊的新系列。

segments.en: Okay.
What is small talk, Marco?
Well, small talk is just everyday conversation about maybe the weather, about how you are, what's new in your life, etc.
segments.cn: 嗯，闲聊就是关于天气、你怎么样、你生活中有什么新鲜事等日常对话。

segments.en: It's just plain conversation.
So something very simple and usually pretty quick.
segments.cn: 所以是非常简单且通常很快的事情。

segments.en: It's what you say to people when you bump into them or when you see them at a party.
segments.cn: 这是你在遇到人或在派对上见到他们时说的话。

segments.en: So let's take a listen to today's dialogue and find out just what kind of small talk we have.
segments.cn: 那么让我们来听听今天的对话，看看我们有什么样的闲聊。

segments.en: Hey, Michelle, this is my friend James.
He's visiting Shanghai from New York.
Oh, hi, James.
Nice to meet you.
So are you visiting for business or pleasure?
Well, actually a little of both.
I'm meeting some business contacts, but I'm also taking some Mandarin classes too.
segments.cn: 我在见一些商业联系人，但我也在上普通话课。

segments.en: Oh, that's cool.
How's it going?
Well, I'm finding the classes pretty tough actually, but I'm having a great time in Shanghai.
segments.cn: 嗯，我发现课程其实挺难的，但我在上海过得很愉快。

segments.en: It's really an amazing city.
segments.cn: 这真是个了不起的城市。

segments.en: It sure is.
Are you staying for long?
Only two weeks, unfortunately.
I wish I could stay longer, but... Well, listen, if you need someone to show you the sights, then just call me.
segments.cn: 我希望能待久一点，但……好吧，听着，如果你需要人带你去看看风景，就给我打电话。

segments.en: I'm having a little get together at my new apartment next week, so if you want to drop by then... That sounds great.
segments.cn: 我下周在我新公寓有个小聚会，如果你想来……那听起来不错。

segments.en: I'd love to.
Let me take down your number, Michelle.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at a lot of great phrases that we've picked out for you this time on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看这次在流利表达中为你挑选的许多精彩短语。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
All right, so I've got two Fluency Builders today, so we're going to be exploring a lot of different phrases.
segments.cn: 好的，我今天有两个流利表达，所以我们将探索许多不同的短语。

segments.en: We've got three now.
The first one is very, very common.
You hear this phrase, nice to meet you.
segments.cn: 你会听到这个短语，很高兴见到你。

segments.en: Right, so obviously if you meet someone new, you're introduced by your friend or something, you can just say, hi, nice to meet you.
segments.cn: 对，所以显然如果你遇到新朋友，或者被朋友介绍，你可以说，嗨，很高兴见到你。

segments.en: All right, so nice to meet you, nice to meet you, too.
segments.cn: 好的，所以很高兴见到你，也很高兴见到你。

segments.en: That's what we say afterwards because it sounds very funny if you say it two times.
segments.cn: 这就是我们之后说的，因为如果你说两次听起来很有趣。

segments.en: So, right.
Hi, it's nice to meet you.
Oh, it's nice to meet you, too.
Right, exactly.
So she went on this girl, Michelle, to ask if he is visiting Shanghai for business or pleasure.
segments.cn: 所以她问这个女孩Michelle，问他是来上海出差还是度假。

segments.en: This is an important difference, something that we often talk about in small talk.
segments.cn: 这是一个重要的区别，我们在闲聊中经常提到。

segments.en: You can travel for business.
That means business trips where you can travel to see different sites and have fun.
segments.cn: 这意味着商务旅行，你可以去看不同的景点并享受乐趣。

segments.en: That's called pleasure.
And so we often hear this phrase, business or pleasure.
segments.cn: 所以我们经常听到这个短语，出差还是度假。

segments.en: Right.
So if someone comes to your country, you say, oh, so are you here for business or pleasure?
segments.cn: 所以如果有人来你国家，你会说，哦，你是来出差还是度假？

segments.en: Oh, I'm here on business or I'm here to see the sights.
segments.cn: 哦，我是来出差的，或者我是来看看风景的。

segments.en: OK, very good.
And so James is actually in Shanghai doing both things.
segments.cn: 所以James实际上是在上海做这两件事。

segments.en: He's on a business trip, but he's also taking Mandarin classes.
segments.cn: 他在出差，但他也在上普通话课。

segments.en: And so Michelle went on to say, that's great.
How's it going?
All right, you're going to hear this all the time in English.
segments.cn: 好的，你会在英语中经常听到这个。

segments.en: We say, how's it going to our friends and family?
segments.cn: 我们对朋友和家人说，进展如何？

segments.en: I wouldn't say it in a formal occasion with my boss or with my teacher, but it's very casual, very informal.
segments.cn: 我不会在正式场合对我的老板或老师说，但这非常随意，非常非正式。

segments.en: And it's a way to ask how things are.
segments.cn: 这是一种询问情况的方式。

segments.en: So you're taking classes.
How's it going?
Exactly.
So this basically means how are the classes going?
segments.cn: 所以这基本上意味着课程进行得怎么样？

segments.en: How is everything?
Right.
Or you could say, oh, Marco, I haven't seen you in a while.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，哦，Marco，我好久没见你了。

segments.en: How is it going?
And that's another way of saying hi to someone or saying, how are you?
segments.cn: 这也是问候某人或询问你怎么样的另一种方式。

segments.en: How are you?
How have you been recently?
So there are two differences in that phrase there.
segments.cn: 所以这个短语有两个不同的意思。

segments.en: In this case, Michelle is asking how the Mandarin classes are going.
segments.cn: 在这种情况下，Michelle在问普通话课进行得怎么样。

segments.en: How is it?
Is it good?
Is it bad?
Is it difficult?
Is it easy, etc.
But if you say to someone, hi, I haven't seen you for such a long time.
segments.cn: 但如果你对某人说，嗨，我好久没见你了。

segments.en: How's it going?
That's more of a how are you type thing.
That's like how's your life going.
segments.cn: 就像是你生活得怎么样。

segments.en: Exactly.
So just think about what you're talking about.
segments.cn: 所以只需考虑你在谈论什么。

segments.en: Are you talking about general situations like a person's life?
segments.cn: 你是在谈论一般情况，比如一个人的生活吗？

segments.en: Or are you talking about maybe lessons or class or a job?
segments.cn: 还是在谈论课程或工作？

segments.en: That's right.
Okay.
So we're going to take a break here.
segments.cn: 所以我们在这里休息一下。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue again.
And we'll be back in a little bit with more phrases.
segments.cn: 我们稍后会回来，带来更多短语。

segments.en: Hey, Michelle, this is my friend, James.
He's visiting Shanghai from New York.
Oh, hi, James.
Nice to meet you.
So are you visiting for business or pleasure?
Well, actually a little of both.
I'm meeting some business contacts, but I'm also taking some Mandarin classes too.
segments.cn: 我在见一些商业联系人，但我也在上普通话课。

segments.en: Oh, that's cool.
How's it going?
Well, I'm finding the class is pretty tough actually.
segments.cn: 其实我觉得这门课挺难的。

segments.en: But I'm having a great time in Shanghai.
segments.cn: 但我在上海过得很愉快。

segments.en: It's really an amazing city.
segments.cn: 这真是个令人惊叹的城市。

segments.en: It sure is.
Are you staying for long?
Only two weeks, unfortunately.
I wish I could stay longer, but... Well, listen, if you need someone to show you the sights, then just call me.
segments.cn: 我希望能待久一点，但……好吧，听着，如果你需要人带你去看景点，随时给我打电话。

segments.en: I'm having a little get together at my new apartment next week.
segments.cn: 我下周在我新公寓里举办一个小聚会。

segments.en: So if you want to drop by then... That sounds great.
segments.cn: 所以如果你想来……听起来不错。

segments.en: I'd love to.
Let me take down your number, Michelle.
segments.cn: 让我记下你的号码，米歇尔。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at Fluency Builder Part 2.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利构建第二部分。

segments.en: So Michelle at the end of today's dialogue says, if you need someone to show you the sights, then just call me.
segments.cn: 所以米歇尔在今天对话的最后说，如果你需要人带你去看景点，随时给我打电话。

segments.en: All right, so to show someone the sights.
We talked about this a little bit earlier with that word pleasure.
segments.cn: 我们之前稍微提到过这个词“愉快”。

segments.en: What does it mean to show someone the sights, Marco?
segments.cn: 带人去看景点是什么意思，马尔科？

segments.en: So basically the sights, we're talking about the different attractions of a city or place.
segments.cn: 基本上，景点是指城市或地方的不同景点。

segments.en: So the museums, maybe different buildings, or different attractions in general.
segments.cn: 比如博物馆、不同的建筑，或者一般的不同景点。

segments.en: What is there to sight see?
Okay, so we are in Paris, Marco, and I say, hey, I'd love to show you the sights.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在巴黎，马尔科，我说，嘿，我很想带你去看景点。

segments.en: What do you expect to see?
So maybe we would go to the Eiffel Tower.
segments.cn: 也许我们会去埃菲尔铁塔。

segments.en: Maybe we would go to... Notre Dame Cathedral.
segments.cn: 也许我们会去……巴黎圣母院。

segments.en: Exactly.
So we would go see all these different sights.
segments.cn: 所以我们会去看所有这些不同的景点。

segments.en: And that would mean that you are showing me the sights.
segments.cn: 这就意味着你在带我去看这些景点。

segments.en: You are taking me to see all these sights.
segments.cn: 你带我去看所有这些景点。

segments.en: Okay.
Okay.
And she is also having a little get together at her apartment, at her new apartment.
segments.cn: 她也在她的新公寓里举办一个小聚会。

segments.en: So what is a little get together?
This is a noun.
This is a get together.
So think about this.
Two different words, actually.
segments.cn: 实际上是两个不同的词。

segments.en: Get together.
But it's a noun, it's a thing.
segments.cn: 但它是一个名词，是一个事物。

segments.en: It's like a party, but it's a small party.
segments.cn: 就像一个派对，但它是一个小派对。

segments.en: A little get together.
So I just, I like to think of a get together as something very casual, something very small, sometimes intimate, where you just have three or four or five friends.
segments.cn: 我喜欢把聚会想象成非常随意的东西，非常小，有时是亲密的，只有三、四或五个朋友。

segments.en: And it's, yeah, it's not as big as a party where everyone's dancing.
segments.cn: 而且，是的，它没有像大家都在跳舞的派对那么大。

segments.en: Okay.
So a little get together is just a small group of people.
segments.cn: 所以小聚会就是一小群人。

segments.en: You invite them over to your house.
Very relaxed, very casual.
It's not really a party.
It's more of a reunion of friends.
And like we said, it's a noun.
segments.cn: 就像我们说的，这是一个名词。

segments.en: So you say, I'm having a get together, you should come.
segments.cn: 所以你说，我在举办一个聚会，你应该来。

segments.en: Okay.
And she actually asks him to come, but she says it in a different way.
segments.cn: 她实际上邀请他来，但她用不同的方式说。

segments.en: If you want to drop by.
Okay.
This is something people often say in small talk because you don't want to say, you should come stay for a while because that's, I don't know.
segments.cn: 这是人们在闲聊中常说的，因为你不想说，你应该来待一会儿，因为那样，我不知道。

segments.en: They just met.
It's not in order.
Yeah.
So you should drop by means you should come and see and decide if you want to stay.
segments.cn: 所以你应该来意味着你应该来看看，决定是否想留下。

segments.en: So basically it's also kind of a relaxed way of saying you can come whenever you want during our party or our get together.
segments.cn: 所以基本上这也是一种放松的方式，表示你可以在我们的聚会或小聚会期间随时来。

segments.en: So if the get together is 9 PM to midnight, you can drop by whenever.
segments.cn: 所以如果聚会是晚上9点到午夜，你可以随时来。

segments.en: 10 o'clock, 11 o'clock.
So to drop by is to come for a short period.
segments.cn: 所以来一下就是短暂地来。

segments.en: So if we're talking on the phone and I say, I'll drop by your house later on today, that means I'm going to go to your house very quickly at an unexpected time.
segments.cn: 所以如果我们在电话中，我说，我今天稍后会去你家，那意味着我会在一个意想不到的时间快速去你家。

segments.en: Yeah.
Or you could use it in a question, you know, Marco, I really wanted to borrow that DVD.
segments.cn: 或者你可以用它来提问，你知道，马尔科，我真的想借那张DVD。

segments.en: When can I drop by to pick it up?
Okay.
Very, very good.
Now let's take a look at our last phrase.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看最后一个短语。

segments.en: Michelle and James decided that they want to keep in touch.
segments.cn: 米歇尔和詹姆斯决定保持联系。

segments.en: And so he said, let me take down your number.
segments.cn: 所以他说，让我记下你的号码。

segments.en: Okay.
So we're not talking about taking it anywhere, taking a number anywhere and going somewhere.
segments.cn: 所以我们不是在说把号码带到哪里，而是写下某些东西。

segments.en: We're talking about writing something down.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，你的号码是你的电话号码。

segments.en: So in this case, your number is your phone number.
Okay.
segments.cn: 让我记下你的号码意味着让我写下你的电话号码。

segments.en: Let me take down your number means let me write down your telephone number.
Okay.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种说法，表示让我写下你的电话号码。

segments.en: So it's another way of saying, let me write down your telephone number.
Take down my phone number.
Call me later.
That's right.
segments.cn: 我可以记下你的号码，以便稍后给你打电话吗？

segments.en: Can I take down your number so I can call you later?
segments.cn: 这就是另一种问这个问题的方式。

segments.en: That's another way of asking this question.
Very good.
All right.
segments.cn: 所以这就结束了流利构建。

segments.en: So that concludes Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 让我们最后再听一遍对话，稍后我们会回来。

segments.en: Let's listen to our dialogue one last time and we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 嘿，米歇尔，这是我的朋友詹姆斯。

segments.en: Hey, Michelle, this is my friend James.
He's visiting Shanghai from New York.
Oh, hi, James.
So are you visiting for business or pleasure?
Well, actually a little of both.
I'm meeting some business contacts, but I'm also taking some Mandarin classes too.
segments.cn: 我在见一些商业联系人，但我也在上普通话课。

segments.en: Oh, that's cool.
How's it going?
Well, I'm finding the classes pretty tough actually, but I'm having a great time in Shanghai.
segments.cn: 其实我觉得课程挺难的，但我在上海过得很愉快。

segments.en: It's really an amazing city.
segments.cn: 这真是个了不起的城市。

segments.en: It sure is.
Are you staying for long?
Only two weeks, unfortunately.
I wish I could stay longer, but... Well, listen, if you need someone to show you the sites, then just call me.
segments.cn: 我希望能待久一点，但……好吧，如果你需要人带你去看看景点，随时给我打电话。

segments.en: I'm having a little get together at my new apartment next week.
segments.cn: 我下周在新公寓有个小聚会。

segments.en: So if you want to drop by then... That sounds great.
segments.cn: 所以如果你想来……听起来不错。

segments.en: I'd love to.
Let me take down your number, Michelle.
segments.cn: 让我记下你的号码，米歇尔。

segments.en: Okay, so this is part one of our small talk series.
segments.cn: 好的，这是我们小谈话系列的第一部分。

segments.en: We're going to have 10 episodes.
And in each episode, we're going to be faced with a little different situation or circumstance where we will be forced to have a very quick chat with someone.
segments.cn: 每一集我们都会面临不同的情况或环境，需要与某人进行快速交谈。

segments.en: That's right.
And so you're often going to find yourself in these situations if you're traveling to an English speaking country or you're living or working in America, for example.
segments.cn: 如果你去英语国家旅行，或者在美国生活或工作，你常常会遇到这些情况。

segments.en: And so it's really important because I think oftentimes you don't learn this in class.
segments.cn: 所以这真的很重要，因为我认为你在课堂上通常学不到这些。

segments.en: This is something that you have to really learn when you're in the country or learn with us here at EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 这是你在国外时必须真正学习的东西，或者在EnglishPod和我们一起学习。

segments.en: That's right.
It's a little bit of social skills for these awkward or maybe new situations.
segments.cn: 这是一些社交技巧，适用于这些尴尬或新奇的情况。

segments.en: All right.
So if you guys have any other questions or doubts, you can find us at EnglishPod.com and we'll see everyone there.
segments.cn: 如果你们有其他问题或疑虑，可以在EnglishPod.com找到我们，我们会在那里见到大家。

segments.en: Bye, guys.
